description.message: This plug-in allows the front-end to solve the development environment can not cross-domain request background interface data annoyance

allow_origin_desc.message: The origin parameter specifies a URI that may access the resource.  The browser must enforce this.  For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

allow_headers_desc.message: Used in response to a preflight request to indicate which HTTP headers can be used when making the actual request.

expose_headers_desc.message: This header lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

allow_credentials_desc.message: Indicates whether or not the response to the request can be exposed when the credentials flag is true.  When used as part of a response to a preflight request, this indicates whether or not the actual request can be made using credentials.  Note that simple GET requests are not preflighted, and so if a request is made for a resource with credentials, if this header is not returned with the resource, the response is ignored by the browser and not returned to web content.

max_age_desc.message: This header indicates how long the results of a preflight request can be cached. The delta-seconds parameter indicates the number of seconds the results can be cached.

allow_methods_desc.message: Specifies the method or methods allowed when accessing the resource.  This is used in response to a preflight request.
